_header: Whoso goeth to church against his will
Note:
Cf. Oxford, Bodleian Library Laud misc. 165 (SC 1562), f. 508; printed by Smalley (1953)
XSmalley, Beryl. “Which William of Nottingham?” Mediaeval and Renaissance Studies 3 (1953): 201-2, 214.
_description: A proverbial saying about unwilling attendance at church, trans. Latin ‘Ad templum strictus sine velle redit maledictus’ — one couplet

BodDou52.Editions:
Förster,  Max. 
             “Die Mittelenglische Sprichwörtersammlung in Douce 52.” 
             Festschrift zum XII Deutschen Neuphilolgentage in München
                1906.
            E. Stollreither, ed. 
         Erlangen (1906): 40-64: 47.

RylandsLat394.Transcription:
Who so gooth to þe chirche ageyn his wyllehe comes home
                    acursed
RylandsLat394.Editions:
Pantin,  William A. 
             “A Medieval Collection of Latin and English Proverbs…from Rylands
                Latin MS. 394.” 
             Bulletin of the John Rylands Library
         14 (1930): 81-114: 99.
